added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Copyright 2012 IBM Corp. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from lxml import etree from tempest.common.rest_client import RestClientXML from tempest.services.compute.xml.common import Document from tempest.services.compute.xml.common import Element from tempest.services.compute.xml.common import Text from tempest.services.compute.xml.common import xml_to_json class KeyPairsClientXML(RestClientXML): def __init__(self, config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name=None): super(KeyPairsClientXML, self).__init__(config, username, password, auth_url, tenant_name) self.service = self.config.compute.catalog_type def list_keypairs(self): resp, body = self.get("os-keypairs", self.headers) node = etree.fromstring(body) body = [{'keypair': xml_to_json(x)} for x in node.getchildren()] return resp, body def get_keypair(self, key_name): resp, body = self.get("os-keypairs/%s" % str(key_name), self.headers) body = xml_to_json(etree.fromstring(body)) return resp, body def create_keypair(self, name, pub_key=None): doc = Document() keypair_element = Element("keypair") if pub_key: public_key_element = Element("public_key") public_key_text = Text(pub_key) public_key_element.append(public_key_text) keypair_element.append(public_key_element) name_element = Element("name") name_text = Text(name) name_element.append(name_text) keypair_element.append(name_element) doc.append(keypair_element) resp, body = self.post("os-keypairs", headers=self.headers, body=str(doc)) body = xml_to_json(etree.fromstring(body)) return resp, body def delete_keypair(self, key_name): return self.delete("os-keypairs/%s" % str(key_name))

subject: Add test_discover module to provide a load_tests hook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 20:12:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/212e67b414327844325741c40b257a86ab0c4613', 'message': "Add test_discover package to provide a discovery hook

This commit adds a load_tests hook that will be used to discover the
set of tempest tests. We can't just discover from the tempest topdir
like we previously did because of mutually exclusive requirements
between the normal tempest tests and the unit tests. (for example mox
and mock should not be required for a tempest run)

Change-Id: I562f033d78e654675fd77af3bf64c44945127bd7
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-17 15:29:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/321406a776cac18bd99eff68066997dd04cc302a', 'message': "Add test_discover module to provide a load_tests hook

This commit adds a load_tests hook that will be used to discover the
set of tempest tests that excludes the unit tests. We can't just
discover from the tempest topdir like we previously did because of
mutually exclusive requirements between the normal tempest tests and
the unit tests. (for example mox and mock should not be required for

Change-Id: I562f033d78e654675fd77af3bf64c44945127bd7
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-18 19:52:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/test_discover/test_discover.py', 'tempest/test_discover/__init__.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/87f772c0bd59790aa43de59938d9c138963f9f4e', 'message': "Add test_discover module to provide a load_tests hook

This commit adds a load_tests hook that will be used to discover the
set of tempest tests that excludes the unit tests. We can't just
discover from the tempest topdir like we previously did because of
mutually exclusive requirements between the normal tempest tests and
the unit tests. (for example mox and mock should not be required for
a tempest run)

Change-Id: I562f033d78e654675fd77af3bf64c44945127bd7

commit_message:
Add test_discover module to provide a load_tests hook

This commit adds a load_tests hook that will be used to discover the
set of tempest tests that excludes the unit tests. We can't just
discover from the tempest topdir like we previously did because of
mutually exclusive requirements between the normal tempest tests and
the unit tests. (for example mox and mock should not be required for
a tempest run)

Change-Id: I562f033d78e654675fd77af3bf64c44945127bd7

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import unittest def load_tests(loader, tests, pattern): suite = unittest.TestSuite() base_path = os.path.split(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)))[0] base_path = os.path.split(base_path)[0] suite.addTests(tests) for test_dir in ['./tempest/api', './tempest/cli', './tempest/scenario', './tempest/thirdparty']: if not pattern: suite.addTests(loader.discover(test_dir, top_level_dir=base_path)) else: suite.addTests(loader.discover(test_dir, pattern=pattern, top_level_dir=base_path)) return suite

output.

commit_message:
Add nested resource references to resource group

Originally, there was no way to get references to the
resources inside the resource group. This prevented
things like attaching volumes to instances in the group.
This patch allows both aggregated as well as indexed
access to ref id's of the nested resources.

Closes-Bug: #1259830
Change-Id: Id13eb6edd91bfc34d8bab05f429e761fe89ed799

When an image is created empty with v2 its size is None.

Change-Id: I8322d012b2ed15cf3fed769776c20b6489f8e9a0
Closes-bug: #1258160

commit_message:
Allow updating empty created v2 images from v1

When an image is created empty with v2 its size is None.
This behavior was causing v1 to fail when trying to update the image since
it expects an integer - in this case 0.

Change-Id: I8322d012b2ed15cf3fed769776c20b6489f8e9a0
Closes-bug: #1258160
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/59/62259/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Prevent g-api from failing if image was created # by v2 with an empty size (None) image_meta['size'] = image_meta['size'] or 0

commit_message:
configure-vm: refactor template formatting

Collapse the three copies of the bare metal NIC template and use the
same dict declaration style used earlier in the script.

Change-Id: I0263d7a3c35cf3ee208012539dddd5176f5dbc7a

commit_message:
Add ovsbridge option to configure-vm

Adds a --ovsbridge for seed VMs. This will cause the public
interface on the seed to be placed on a ovs bridge as an
alternative to the default libvirt network.

Change-Id: Ia19d25087f9b8b21d9ff9da3a41b7a6131b081d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/39/62939/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Separate negative tests for test_fixed_ips

Move negative tests from test_fixed_ips.py to test_fixed_ips_negative.py

Partially implements blueprint negative-test-files
Change-Id: I965b85790463eb5de7c77d237996e469b0c4423f

added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Copyright 2013 NEC Corporation. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.compute import base from tempest import exceptions from tempest.test import attr class FixedIPsTestJson(base.BaseV2ComputeAdminTest): _interface = 'json' @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(FixedIPsTestJson, cls).setUpClass() if cls.config.service_available.neutron: msg = ("%s skipped as neutron is available" % cls.__name__ raise cls.skipException(msg) cls.client = cls.os_adm.fixed_ips_client cls.non_admin_client = cls.fixed_ips_client resp, server = cls.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') resp, server = cls.servers_client.get_server(server['id']) for ip_set in server['addresses']: for ip in server['addresses'][ip_set]: if ip['OS-EXT-IPS:type'] == 'fixed': cls.ip = ip['addr'] break if cls.ip: break @attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_list_fixed_ip_details_with_non_admin_user(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.Unauthorized, self.non_admin_client.get_fixed_ip_details, self.ip) @attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_set_reserve_with_non_admin_user(self): body = {"reserve": "None"} self.assertRaises(exceptions.Unauthorized, self.non_admin_client.reserve_fixed_ip, self.ip, body) @attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_set_unreserve_with_non_admin_user(self): body = {"unreserve": "None"} self.assertRaises(exceptions.Unauthorized, self.non_admin_client.reserve_fixed_ip, self.ip, body) @attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_set_reserve_with_invalid_ip(self): # NOTE(maurosr): since this exercises the same code snippet, we do it # only for reserve action body = {"reserve": "None"} self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.client.reserve_fixed_ip, "my.invalid.ip", body) @attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_fixed_ip_with_invalid_action(self): body = {"invalid_action": "None"} self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.client.reserve_fixed_ip, self.ip, body) class FixedIPsTestXml(FixedIPsTestJson): _interface = 'xml'

commit_message:
Drop dependency on lockutils from oslo db code

While lockutils is a useful module, it registers a few oslo.config
options, which can possibly lead to unpleasant issues
(DuplicateOptError) when we split oslo.db from oslo-incubator into a
separate library and reuse both lockutils and oslo.db in target
projects. Unfortunately, we can't just remove usage of oslo.config
options from locktutils as it can break backward compatibility for
existing deployments.
The general approach of solving DuplicateOptError issues for oslo
libraries is not to depend on oslo.config as much as possible. So it's
actually worth to have a small code duplication here for the sake of
oslo.db as a standalone library in the future.

Change-Id: I7e3c5e1e9f7df0fec01e0d484e709cb2375025f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/54/56354/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsimport lockfiledef _set_db_lock(lock_path=None, lock_prefix=None): def decorator(f): @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): try: if not lock_path: lock_path = os.environ.get("OSLO_LOCK_PATH") lock = lockfile.FileLock(os.path.join(lock_path, lock_prefix)) with lock: LOG.debug(_('Got lock "%s"') % f.__name__) return f(*args, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug(_('Lock released "%s"') % f.__name__) return wrapper return decorator @_set_db_lock('pgadmin', 'tests-')
deleted_lines: from openstack.common import lockutils @lockutils.synchronized('pgadmin', 'tests-', external=True)

commit_message:
Fix the grub2 config location for non Ubuntu/Debian systems

Fedora and openSUSE use /boot/grub2/grub.cfg for the grub2
configuration. The path that was used for Fedora before
(/boot/grub/grub.conf) is only valid for older grub releases.

Change-Id: I1e532c73a373a2c3f92211eff52719c2b635b7e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/85/62885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: GRUB_CONFIG_FILE="" if [ -e /boot/grub/grub.cfg ] ; then # Ubuntu and Debian are using /boot/grub/grub.cfg this for the # grub2 configuration GRUB_CONFIG_FILE=/boot/grub/grub.cfg elif [ -e /boot/grub2/grub.cfg ]; then # On openSUSE and recent Fedora releases the grub2 config resides # in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg GRUB_CONFIG_FILE=/boot/grub2/grub.cfg if [ "$GRUB_CONFIG_FILE" ]; then sed -i -e 's/ console=ttyS0//' $GRUB_CONFIG_FILE fi
deleted_lines: GRUB_CONFIG_FILE=/boot/grub/grub.cfg if [ ! -e $GRUB_CONFIG_FILE ] ; then # Fedora grub config file location GRUB_CONFIG_FILE=/boot/grub/grub.confsed -i -e 's/ console=ttyS0//' $GRUB_CONFIG_FILE

commit_message:
Add Host Reservation Admin Manager

API extensions are provided using a RPC dispatcher
We need to explicitly mention plugin:method when calling.
If not, it will stick to core methods for ManagerService.

Implements bp:host-provisioning-api

Change-Id: Ice5a07eef54664651c22b6b1185be38062c7296e

Configure os-collect-config on seed properly

Without this the seed os-collect-config splats errors into its logs
every 30 seconds.

commit_message:
Add element to modify /etc/apt/sources.list in dib

Add apt-sources element for Ubuntu OS to override the default
/etc/apt/sources.list in cloudimg.

Set DIB_APT_SOURCES with a proper sources.list file to replace
the default one.

If you want to use this element in tripleo project, set NODE_DIST or
EXTRA_ELEMENTS / UNDERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS / OVERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS
to make it take effect at build time and run time.

e.g. before running devtest.sh:
export DIB_APT_SOURCES=/etc/apt/sources.list
export NODE_DIST="ubuntu apt-sources"

Change-Id: I9ce0d03b506c2948b96382e4d6e85f0aff906450
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/94/62594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
add support for nova ssh user@host

the nova ssh command is convenient, but it is lacking some basic
niceties that everyone is used to with ssh, for instance actually
doing user@host to connect to an environment. This adds support
for "nova ssh user@host" to work as one would expect.

The functionality is added to both v1.1 and v3 clients. Tests for
this, and other ssh behavior are added to the v1.1 tree (the v3
test_shell.py has not synced over yet).

Change-Id: Ic4081f85c848507ebdc5e228ac345faf19127168

commit_message:
Extend vlan_splinters control behaviour

Change vlan_splinters control in openstack.json from checkbox to
radio group with 3 values: 'disabled', 'soft', and 'hard'.
'Soft' version always provides a 'trunk' field as a [0].
'Hard' version puts all vlan numbers from this interface to a 'trunk'
field.

bug 1257604

Change-Id: I9c1bbfc95eb777937bf0a9654d6f3cbc912055b9

commit_message:
Replace xrange in for loop with six.moves.range

xrange is not supported in python 3, so replace it with six.moves.range

Change-Id: I5213d222ea417d249dbb7e952bb8a7a20096525c
Closes-Bug: #1262147

commit_message:
Revert "Work around neutron floatingip race condition"

This reverts commit 38ac22ce7c4ea4ee9a86e1b6f2c3e5e31c8ba652.

Neutron claim the symptoms are fixed but there may be more issues
under the hood - we should see if thats the case.

Change-Id: I7e4c9448d9fc8ae10522d33495e9f6d2de64c129

deleted_lines: ## #. Add an external IP for it. If this process times out or produces an ## error, you may need to restart neutron-server on the controller and try ## it again. This is due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1254555## neutron floatingip-create ext-net --port-id "${PORT//[[:space:]]/}" ### --end # Ugly hack kept out of docs intentionally. # Workaround neutron bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1254555 ext_net= for try in {1..12} ; do ssh -l heat-admin -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -t $OVERCLOUD_IP sudo service neutron-server restart # Give things time to synchronize.. I think. sleep 10 if neutron floatingip-create ext-net --port-id "${PORT//[[:space:]]/}" ; then ext_net=1 break fi done if [ -z "$ext_net" ] ; then echo Still cannot find ext-net after $try tries. exit 42 fi ### --include

commit_message:
Implement periodic execution of benchmark scenarios

Being able to run benchmark scenarios not continuously but periodically,
setting the interval between two consecutive benchmark scenario launches,
is a crucial part of making Rally closer to real-world cloud usage scenarios.

Here we add such a capability by adding a new execution type, namely
"periodic". We also add new scenario config parameter "interval" which
enables the user to set the interval between two consecutive scenario
launches in minutes.

A sample benchmark config for periodical booting/deleting 5 servers, one
server every 2 minutes, now would look like this:

"benchmark": {
    "NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server": [
        {"args": {"flavor_id": 1,
                  "image_id": "73257560-c59b-4275-a1ec-ab140e5b9979"},
         "execution": "periodic",
         "config": {"times": 5, "period": 2,
                    "tenants": 3, "users_per_tenant": 2}}
    ]
}

Blueprint flexible-benchmark-config

Change-Id: I21a0a89f60bd5aaf9b3f419f72cdec7842bc7c38

added_lines: @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils._run_scenario_loop") @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.time.sleep") @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.osclients") def test_run_scenario_periodically(self, mock_osclients, mock_sleep, mock_run_scenario_loop): mock_osclients.Clients.return_value = test_utils.FakeClients() runner = utils.ScenarioRunner(mock.MagicMock(), self.fake_kw) utils.__openstack_clients__ = ["client"] times = 3 interval = 4 timeout = 5 runner._run_scenario_periodically({}, FakeScenario, "do_it", {}, times, interval, timeout) expected = [mock.call((i, FakeScenario, "do_it", {}, {})) for i in xrange(times)] self.assertEqual(mock_run_scenario_loop.mock_calls, expected) expected = [mock.call(interval) for i in xrange(times - 1)] self.assertEqual(mock_sleep.mock_calls, expected) def test_run_continuous(self, mock_osclients, mock_base, mock_clients): @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.osclients") @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.base") @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.osclients") def test_run_periodic(self, mock_osclients, mock_base, mock_clients): FakeScenario = mock.MagicMock() FakeScenario.init = mock.MagicMock(return_value={}) mock_osclients.Clients.return_value = test_utils.FakeClients() runner = utils.ScenarioRunner(mock.MagicMock(), self.fake_kw) runner._run_scenario_periodically = mock.MagicMock( return_value="result") runner._create_temp_tenants_and_users = mock.MagicMock( return_value=[]) runner._delete_temp_tenants_and_users = mock.MagicMock() mock_base.Scenario.get_by_name = \ mock.MagicMock(return_value=FakeScenario) mock_clients.return_value = ["client"] result = runner._run_scenario({}, FakeScenario, "do_it", {"a": 1}, "periodic", {"times": 2, "interval": 3, "timeout": 1}) self.assertEqual(result, "result") runner._run_scenario_periodically.assert_called_once_with( {}, FakeScenario, "do_it", {"a": 1}, 2, 3, 1)

commit_message:
Separate negative tests for list_floating_ips

Add negative tests for test_list_floating_ips to a specific file.
Since no floating_ips are needed to setup for negative test,
generation of non existent id can be simplified.

bp negative-test-files

Change-Id: I1d3ac0956ea3f69bbd5bde897f0a18fc0e182930

subject: Addressed underlying issues associated with misplaced colon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-18 02:31:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/97e552c8ea2017b2f7d60b69330a5c1774b31704', 'message': "Addressed underlying issues associated with misplaced colon

Upon further investigation, the 'NOVA_DBPASS' reference in the
sentence including the misplaced colon should reside with the database
creation step now located further into this section.  The best
solution probably involves opening another bug to clarify this
section by reordering several steps.  For example, database creation
seems like a prerequisite for configuring the 'connection' key in
nova.conf.  Additionally, at least in the Ubuntu guide, configuring
the keys under [keystone_authtoken] in nova.conf should reside with
the step configuring Compute to use the Identity Service.

In the meantime, unless suggested otherwise, I changed the minimal
number of items to remove the misplaced colon and improve clarity
using the existing sequence of steps.

Change-Id: I5b24d55f236b6b4cf675707ebce34180187b788e
Closes-Bug: #1261607

commit_message:
Addressed underlying issues associated with misplaced colon

Upon further investigation, the 'NOVA_DBPASS' reference in the
sentence including the misplaced colon should reside with the database
creation step now located further into this section.  The best
solution probably involves opening another bug to clarify this
section by reordering several steps.  For example, database creation
seems like a prerequisite for configuring the 'connection' key in
nova.conf.  Additionally, at least in the Ubuntu guide, configuring
the keys under [keystone_authtoken] in nova.conf should reside with
the step configuring Compute to use the Identity Service.

In the meantime, unless suggested otherwise, I changed the minimal
number of items to remove the misplaced colon and improve clarity
using the existing sequence of steps.

Change-Id: I5b24d55f236b6b4cf675707ebce34180187b788e
Closes-Bug: #1261607

commit_message:
Python 3: use six.moves.zip() rather than itertools.izip()

This ensures compatibility with both Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Id9838b7517f939e5ee3e3a8c37ae5ec2e9b1d18b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/42/63042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for field, field_label in six.moves.zip(fields, field_labels):
deleted_lines: import itertools for field, field_label in itertools.izip(fields, field_labels):

commit_message:
Remove premature restart of Keystone service during configuration

For simplification purposes, restarting the Keystone service
should wait until after configuring all relevant directives
in keystone.conf.

Change-Id: Id26edc20236953215dd18635fbe143f4bc1bc8da
Closes-Bug: #1258651

commit_message:
Strip '/' from api_url string for PXE driver

Because ironic_api_url PXE option used in hardcoded script for posting
callback data we should use only url string without '/' on the end.
It is necessary for case if Ironic API URL option set like
"http://127.0.0.1:6385/".

Change-Id: Iddd237e8aa90fd17f836cfd2060468f34e0de232
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/05/60205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: CONF.set_default('api_url', 'http://192.168.122.184:6385',

commit_message:
Fix XML to JSON parser

Some response bodies has got a lists as part of values for some
keys, but when XML is being parsed this is not considered.
Because of that tests that work correctly for JSON fail for XML.

Closes-bug: #1259870

Change-Id: Ib9b5c2d695258102bbc932f7babc614b0f847455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/03/61403/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def xml_to_json(node, list_keys=None): do_list = list_keys is not None and node.tag.split("}")[1] in list_keys if do_list: json = [] else: json = {} for attr in node.keys(): if not attr.startswith("xmlns"): json[attr] = node.get(attr) child_json = xml_to_json(child, list_keys) if not do_list: json[tag] = child_json else: json.append(child_json)
deleted_lines: def xml_to_json(node): json = {} for attr in node.keys(): if not attr.startswith("xmlns"): json[attr] = node.get(attr) json[tag] = xml_to_json(child)

commit_message:
Add quotes around $DISTRO

The lsb_release -si output might contain spaces. E.g. on openSUSE it is
"openSUSE project".

Change-Id: I0e37bab54d0156f484433246bba7cdc686326c86

commit_message:
Set the correct path to os-collect-config

os-collect-config is installed in /usr/bin. This adjusts the systemd
service file accordingly to make it work for openSUSE. On Fedora the
wrong path didn't cause any problems because /bin is just a symlink to
/usr/bin there.

Change-Id: I2f02b12f9667920196084ee0abef1c9f676d413a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/90/62890/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: ExecStart=/bin/os-collect-config

commit_message:
Switch to oslo-incubator mask_password

oslo-incubator has a mask_password now, so use that rather than
keystone's.

Change-Id: I3d89fb844086b85598ad3fd7ae0daa7599a26a30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/17/62517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('%s = %s', key, logging.mask_password(value)) LOG.debug('%s', logging.mask_password(line))
deleted_lines: def mask_password(message, is_unicode=False, secret="***"): """Replace password with 'secret' in message. :param message: The string which include security information. :param is_unicode: Is unicode string ? :param secret: substitution string default to "***". :returns: The string For example: >>> mask_password('"password" : "aaaaa"') '"password" : "***"' >>> mask_password("'original_password' : 'aaaaa'") "'original_password' : '***'" >>> mask_password("u'original_password' : u'aaaaa'") "u'original_password' : u'***'" """ if is_unicode: message = unicode(message) # Match the group 1,2 and replace all others with 'secret' secret = r"\g<1>" + secret + r"\g<2>" result = _RE_PASS.sub(secret, message) return result LOG.debug('%s = %s', key, mask_password(value, is_unicode=True)) LOG.debug(mask_password(line))

commit_message:
Use Image IDs to make image based updates work

Currently Heat won't know that the Image ID of the names have changed,
so we have to pass in new image ids to make sure the updates actually
deploy the new image.

We change load-image to just output the Image ID to make this task
simpler.

Change-Id: I13031356c09cdeb3a606fd42da91cb8febc9849d

commit_message:
Use BaseTestCase from oslo Part 1

Replace base class for tests with BaseTestCase from
openstack/common/test.py

In this part only tests which inherit
from old base class directly are changed.

Oslo commit: 5d6d24c4e7d674b3f804e250983e835840b45039

Change-Id: Ia4bae39c00cde0a6accc2f6b4e55fc973d7d0ea1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/15/48215/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance.openstack.common import test from glance.openstack.common.fixture import config as test_config from glance.openstack.common.fixture import moxstubout class TestPasteApp(test.BaseTestCase): self.stubs = self.useFixture(moxstubout.MoxStubout()).stubs self.config = self.useFixture(test_config.Config()).config config.parse_args(args=[])
deleted_lines: import stuboutfrom glance.tests import utils as test_utils class TestPasteApp(test_utils.BaseTestCase): self.stubs = stubout.StubOutForTesting() self.addCleanup(self.stubs.UnsetAll)

subject: Run DB API tests on a given DB backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-06-17 09:57:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/acd9d9dfce4ec15c3d5e40cee2014451a5fd809e', 'message': "Run DB API tests on a given DB backend.

To proposed solution:
  - uses testrepository facilities to create a separate test
    environment for each process running a portion of test
    cases, i. e. a separate DB is created for each of test processes,
    so that they can safely be run concurrently without any data races
  - DB transactions are used to ensure that DB remains in a clean state
    after running of a test case: each test case is executed within a
    transaction which is rolled back after the test has ended.
    The 'create DB/apply migrations/run a test case/drop DB' pattern
    we currently use for running tests on SQLite in-memory DB is not an
    option, because it would take enormous amount of time to do this
    for MySQL or PostgreSQL
  - a new tox environment is added for running of DB API tests
    (as these are the only tests we want to run on DB backends other
    than SQLite in-memory DB)

To run DB API tests on a specific DB backend do:
  OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=mysql://test:test@localhost/test tox -e dbapi

Note: this connection is used to create/drop test databases/users, ensure that
the specified users has appropriate rights. If OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION
env variable is not specified, DB API tests are run on SQLite in-memory DB.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: Ia1128c4f9d1230935a78a2c2363daacafef0f4db

To run DB API tests on a specific DB backend do:
  OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=mysql://test:test@localhost/test tox -e dbapi

Note: this connection is used to create/drop test databases/users, ensure that
the specified users has appropriate rights. If OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION
env variable is not specified, DB API tests are run on SQLite in-memory DB.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: Ia1128c4f9d1230935a78a2c2363daacafef0f4db

commit_message:
Run DB API tests on a given DB backend

To proposed solution:
  - uses testrepository facilities to create a separate test
    environment for each process running a portion of test
    cases, i. e. a separate DB is created for each of test processes,
    so that they can safely be run concurrently without any data races
  - DB transactions are used to ensure that DB remains in a clean state
    after running of a test case: each test case is executed within a
    transaction which is rolled back after the test has ended.
    The 'create DB/apply migrations/run a test case/drop DB' pattern
    we currently use for running tests on SQLite in-memory DB is not an
    option, because it would take enormous amount of time to do this
    for MySQL or PostgreSQL
  - a new tox environment is added for running of DB API tests
    (as these are the only tests we want to run on DB backends other
    than SQLite in-memory DB)

To run DB API tests on a specific DB backend do:
  OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=mysql://test:test@localhost/test tox -e dbapi

Note: this connection is used to create/drop test databases/users, ensure that
the specified users has appropriate rights. If OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION
env variable is not specified, DB API tests are run on SQLite in-memory DB.

Uses code from oslo-incubator, that hasn't been merged yet:
Ic5d3cfe8764b3c04affe79088473255c17535e54

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Co-authored-By: Ilya Pekelny <ipekelny@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ia1128c4f9d1230935a78a2c2363daacafef0f4db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/33236/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:dbapi] # To run DB API tests on a specific DB backend please set the # OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION environment variable and provide # the connection string to your test DB, e. g.: # OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=sqlite:// tox -e dbapi # OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION=mysql://test:test@localhost/test tox -e dbapi # # NOTE: this connection will be used to create/drop test databases and users, # so the specified DB user must have appropriate rights commands = python tools/patch_tox_venv.py python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='nova.tests.db.test_db_api'

commit_message:
Scripts to run nailgun using external app server.

Scripts description:

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_keepalive
     Run KeepAlive checker in separate process;
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_rcp
     Run RPC consumer in separate process.
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path
     Return path for nailgun_wsgi;
     Will be installed to <venv>/bin.

  nailgun/wsgi/nailgun_wsgi
     WSGI application.
     Will be installed to share directory (see notes below).

Notes:

  If you are using Python 2.7 then shared files are installed inside package.

  If you are using Python 2.6 then nailgun_wsgi is installed to
  <sys.prefix>/share/nailgun_wsgi.

  nailgun_wsgi_path console script returns path to nailgun_wsgi file.
  For example:
    uwsgi -s 127.0.0.1:8001 --wsgi-file $(/opt/nailgun/bin/nailgun_wsgi_path)

Change-Id: I1f5fe75e49feefedee015f4e750d4ae3e2951f33

commit_message:
Use BaseTestCase from oslo Part 2

Replace base class for tests with BaseTestCase from
openstack/common/test.py

Add new base class for tests which need to set
property protections. Inherit StoreClearingUnitTest,
IsolatedUnitTest and UsingPolicyFileMixinTest
from it.

Oslo commit: 5d6d24c4e7d674b3f804e250983e835840b45039

Change-Id: Ifb463ecffc2d7ead9af7fc390353e5d40967bd44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/28/48228/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import stubout from glance.common import config from glance.openstack.common import test from glance.openstack.common.fixture import config as test_config from glance.openstack.common.fixture import moxstuboutclass PropertyProtectionTestCase(test.BaseTestCase): def set_property_protections(self): self.property_file = self._copy_data_file('property-protections.conf', self.test_dir) self.config(property_protection_file=self.property_file) def _copy_data_file(self, file_name, dst_dir): src_file_name = os.path.join('glance/tests/etc', file_name) shutil.copy(src_file_name, dst_dir) dst_file_name = os.path.join(dst_dir, file_name) return dst_file_name def set_property_protection_rules(self, rules): f = open(self.property_file, 'w') for rule_key in rules.keys(): f.write('[%s]\n' % rule_key) for operation in rules[rule_key].keys(): roles_str = ','.join(rules[rule_key][operation]) f.write('%s = %s\n' % (operation, roles_str)) f.close() class StoreClearingUnitTest(PropertyProtectionTestCase): config.parse_args(args=[]) self.moxfixture = self.useFixture(moxstubout.MoxStubout()) self.stubs = self.moxfixture.stubs self.config = self.useFixture(test_config.Config()).config self.addCleanup(setattr, location, 'SCHEME_TO_CLS_MAP', dict())class UsingPolicyFileMixinTest(PropertyProtectionTestCase): config.parse_args(args=[]) self.test_dir = self.useFixture(fixtures.TempDir()).path self.config = self.useFixture(test_config.Config()).config
deleted_lines: import stubout from glance.tests import utils as test_utilsclass StoreClearingUnitTest(test_utils.BaseTestCase): self._create_stores() self.addCleanup(setattr, location, 'SCHEME_TO_CLS_MAP', dict()) def _create_stores(self): """Create known stores. Mock out sheepdog's subprocess dependency on collie. """ self.stubs.Set(sheepdog.Store, 'configure_add', lambda x: None) def _copy_data_file(self, file_name, dst_dir): src_file_name = os.path.join('glance/tests/etc', file_name) shutil.copy(src_file_name, dst_dir) dst_file_name = os.path.join(dst_dir, file_name) return dst_file_name class UsingPolicyFileMixinTest(test_utils.BaseTestCase):

commit_message:
Use /etc/tempest for Tempest conf file

Other projects use /etc to store conf file. According to
lib/template, /etc should be used to store conf file. This
patch makes Tempest compliant.

Change-Id: I862d004bc4b06adc8e7cc86371a6b9fe6179b562
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/34/61434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEMPEST_CONF_DIR=${TEMPEST_CONF_DIR:-/etc/tempest} # Put config files in ``TEMPEST_CONF_DIR`` for everyone to find if [[ ! -d $TEMPEST_CONF_DIR ]]; then sudo mkdir -p $TEMPEST_CONF_DIR fi sudo chown $STACK_USER $TEMPEST_CONF_DIR cp $TEMPEST_DIR/etc/tempest.conf.sample $TEMPEST_CONF
deleted_lines: TEMPEST_CONF_DIR=$TEMPEST_DIR/etc cp $TEMPEST_CONF.sample $TEMPEST_CONF

subject: Add a CLI to disable/enable a flavor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 00:05:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/bdf861188a29d46c791d592cc6f47c32ad437908', 'message': 'Add a REST API to disable/enable a flavor.

If a flavor is disabled, it is invisible to tenants while show a list of flavors.
But if a flavor is already associated with instances, a tenants can still access it by the flavor_id.

usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor> <disabled>

Sample request:
REQ: curl -i 770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12">http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2/770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12
                 -d '{"flavor": {"OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled": true}}

Sample output from CLI:

cloud@devstack:~$ nova help flavor-disabled
usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor_id> <disabled>

Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.

commit_message:
Add a CLI to disable/enable a flavor

If a flavor is disabled, it is invisible to tenants while show a list of flavors.
But if a flavor is already associated with instances, a tenants can still access it by the flavor_id.

usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor> <disabled>

Sample request:
REQ: curl -i 770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12">http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2/770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12
                 -d '{"flavor": {"OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled": true}}

Sample output from CLI:

cloud@devstack:~$ nova help flavor-disabled
usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor_id> <disabled>

Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.

Positional arguments:
  <flavor_id>  flavor id.
  <disabled>   value of disabled (true or false).

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-disabled 12 true
+--------------------------+-------+
| Property                 | Value |
+--------------------------+-------+
| OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled | True  |
| disk                     | 0     |
| extra_specs              | {}    |
| id                       | 12    |
| name                     | test  |
| ram                      | 1024  |
| vcpus                    | 1     |
+--------------------------+-------+

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public | Disabled |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 1    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 12 | test      | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | True     |
| 13 | test1     | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 3  | m1.medium | 4096      | 40   | 0         |      | 2     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 4  | m1.large  | 8192      | 80   | 0         |      | 4     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 42 | m1.nano   | 64        | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 5  | m1.xlarge | 16384     | 160  | 0         |      | 8     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 84 | m1.micro  | 128       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+

Change-Id: I0f244c4bcc7e56d6181445b5d58785607a8dac03
Closes-Bug: #1259262
recheck
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/92/61292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'Disabled',@utils.arg('flavor_id', metavar='<flavor_id>', help="flavor id.") @utils.arg('disabled', metavar='<disabled>', help="value of disabled (true or false).", type=utils.bool_from_str) def do_flavor_disabled(cs, args): """Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.""" flavor = cs.flavors.update(args.flavor_id, args.disabled) _print_flavor(flavor)

commit_message:
Port policy from oslo

Port policy from oslo and update glance/api/policy
Update tests.

Add new base class UsingPolicyFileMixinTest for tests which use
policy file. It helps to add the path to tests/etc/policy.json
as policy_file to CONF.

Add unit tests for Enforcer's methods:
- clear
- set_rules
- load_rules

Oslo commit: 76972e2949634abe9fcc9ad36c103cca94300237

Change-Id: I1132b209dfe09d95ba31a741fbacb3fc499ec2cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/37/46937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use SHA256 for hashing tokens

By coincidence, the table column sizes are big enough for handling
SHA256 hashes, so the only thing needed seems to be to change
the actual hashing algorithm.

Change-Id: I6949ea0bdcfb9c37a83ec968eff9f21cbb974832
Closes-Bug: #1174499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/45/61445/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hasher = hashlib.sha256()
deleted_lines: hasher = hashlib.md5()

commit_message:
Fix simple db's treatment of image tags

Simple db allows setting image tags when calling image_create and returns image
tags as part of the image entity when calling image_get. This is unlike
sqlalchemy driver and is not the correct behavior. Image tags are not part of
the core image entity because v1 of the api should not return them.

This patch also fixes tests that incorrectly expect this behavior.

prerequisite to blueprint remove-simple-driver

Fixes bug 1247655

Change-Id: Iad06279cf59acc542e3b3fc3b72a6050f5c90bc5

commit_message:
Provide a deprecated function

This is starting to be needed in a number of places, provide a decorator
and a print method to notify of deprecated functions attributes or
parameters.

Change-Id: Idaee4ab3b5efe6fbee414a8d6274e60ff584dc74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/86/50186/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsimport loggingimport warnings_logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) def deprecated_msg(name, msg=None): """Log a message that a variable, attribute or function is deprecated.""" message = "%s is deprecated." % name if msg: message += " " message += msg _logger.info(message) warnings.warn(message, category=DeprecationWarning) return message def deprecated(f): """Mark a function or parameter as being deprecated. This will have the same format as deprecated_msg, but is used as a decorator. """ @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): deprecated_msg(f.__name__) return f(*args, **kwargs) return wrapper

commit_message:
Ignore nbactions.xml

This file is a per-user build customization file created by NetBeans,
which is often created for documentation projects to define the
"clean generate-sources" action for easy access in the UI.

Change-Id: I63b8302f41f00858c400f028f1ffec6566fd288d

commit_message:
Use oslo.db sessions

Keystone was using its own keystone.common.sql module for
database access. oslo-incubator's db.sqlalchemy module provides
the same or better functionality, so use that instead.

DocImpact
- The options that were in the [sql] section are deprecated and
  replaced by options in the [database] section. There are
  also several new options in this section. If database
  configuration is described for another project that uses
  oslo-incubator's db.sqlalchemy module the docs can be shared.

Part of bp use-common-oslo-db-code

Change-Id: I25b717d9616e9d31316441ae3671d2f86229c2bf

subject: Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 14:17:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/8929be270931bef0921b7c4adbeaa0028ba171b0', 'message': 'Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError

The "requests" module tries to do this comparison in raise_for_status():

    400 <= self.status_code < 500

with "self.status_code" being "None". In Python2, it's a valid comparison, but
in Python3, it triggers a TypeError. We fix it by giving a value to
"self.status_code".

Change-Id: I9ea9ecfb698546a7f6526464aa528441bb7c1ccd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-16 14:25:25.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/71e13500fe69b9e159968bd8c34e4df8f62707ea', 'message': 'Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError

The "requests" module tries to do this comparison in raise_for_status():

    400 <= self.status_code < 500

with "self.status_code" being "None". In Python2, it's a valid comparison, but
in Python3, it triggers a TypeError. We fix it by giving a valid default value
to "self.status_code".

Change-Id: I9ea9ecfb698546a7f6526464aa528441bb7c1ccd
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid meaningless comparison that leads to a TypeError

The "requests" module tries to do this comparison in raise_for_status():

    400 <= self.status_code < 500

with "self.status_code" being "None". In Python2, it's a valid comparison, but
in Python3, it triggers a TypeError. We fix it by giving a valid default value
to "self.status_code".

Change-Id: I9ea9ecfb698546a7f6526464aa528441bb7c1ccd

added_lines: [tox] minversion = 1.6 envlist = py26,py27,py33,pypy,pep8 skipsdist = True [testenv] usedevelop = True install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages} setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} LANG=en_US.UTF-8 LANGUAGE=en_US:en LC_ALL=C deps = -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='{posargs}' [testenv:pep8] commands = flake8 [testenv:venv] commands = {posargs} [testenv:cover] commands = python setup.py testr --coverage --testr-args='{posargs}' [flake8] # H803 skipped on purpose per list discussion. # E123, E125 skipped as they are invalid PEP-8. show-source = True ignore = E123,E125,H803 builtins = _ exclude=.venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*openstack/common*,*lib/python*,*egg,build

commit_message:
Add another clarifying note on nova-net install

We had another bug report about the nova-network install section.

This patch adds another very explicit,
clarifying note to ensure people are installing
packages in the right place.

Change-Id: Ifc48813af9ec1cf8a87aab96c3f95c8d474595c9
Closes-bug: 1261620
(cherry picked from commit ffa01a2c2314f16f25c7f0179c498297d2f0f9cc)

subject: Fix obj versioning w/non-ASCII container name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-18 18:48:32.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_base.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ace2aa33b19b3ff5abfb3f624414f422f8723b41', 'message': "Fix obj versioning w/non-ASCII container name

If you create a container with a non-ASCII name, and then make another
container with X-Versions-Location: first-cntner, *and* you're
serializing stuff in memcache as json (the default), when the proxy
tries to make a versioned object, it will crash.

The fix is to make sure that get_container_info() always returns strs,
not unicodes.

The long-term fix would be to get rid of simplejson entirely, as its
decoder can't make up its mind whether JSON strings should be Python
strs or unicodes, and that makes it really really easy to write bugs
like this.

Change-Id: Ib20ea5fb884484a4246d7a21a9f1e2ffd82eb04f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix obj versioning w/non-ASCII container name

If you create a container with a non-ASCII name, and then make another
container with X-Versions-Location: first-cntner, *and* you're
serializing stuff in memcache as json (the default), when the proxy
tries to make a versioned object, it will crash.

The fix is to make sure that get_container_info() always returns strs,
not unicodes.

The long-term fix would be to get rid of simplejson entirely, as its
decoder can't make up its mind whether JSON strings should be Python
strs or unicodes, and that makes it really really easy to write bugs
like this.

Change-Id: Ib20ea5fb884484a4246d7a21a9f1e2ffd82eb04f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/53/62953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key in info: if isinstance(info[key], unicode): info[key] = info[key].encode("utf-8")

commit_message:
LXC: Image device should be reset in mount() and teardown()

When fixing bug#1208387, image device name is returned in function
setup_container. But it's missed to reset in function mount() and
teardown().

This patch is to fix it. We now just return the device name when
mounting disk image during setting up container and remove the
member variable 'device' from Class _DiskImage added in last patch.

Closes-bug: #1243108
Related-bug: #1208387

Change-Id: I2aaed6f3367edce4fb23b78f0e979440954609a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/77/53077/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.device = self._mounter.device self.device = None

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in nova.utils and nova.compute.utils

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in nova.utils and nova.compute.utils
and related tests. Removes the unused fake_get method in
test_compute_utils.

Note that the nova.notifications payload isn't updated yet to store
flavor instead of instance_type so this patch still uses
payload['instance_type'] when processing the notification in
test_compute_utils.

Note that instance_type_id and the instance_type_* keys in
system_metadata are part of the data model and would require a database
migration to change, so those are not part of this patch.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I56815e5c8238f8e4ad4e3a2a599310da2b7f4568
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/62254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: instance_type = flavors.extract_flavor(instance) if instance_type['ephemeral_gb']: if instance_type['swap']: instance_type = flavors.extract_flavor(instance) image_system_meta = utils.get_system_metadata_from_image( image, instance_type)

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in nova.cloudpipe

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in the nova.cloudpipe module.

The deprecated vpn_instance_type option is removed as part of
change I64548e40f so I leave it untouched here.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: Id4fd757fabfb81ee81999e7978c924aabd0a712b

deleted_lines: # Deprecated in Havana deprecated_name='vpn_instance_type', instance_type = flavors.get_flavor_by_name( CONF.vpn_flavor) instance_type,

commit_message:
Convert [Cinder]VolumeAttachment to new Schema format

blueprint property-schema-conversion

Change-Id: I93eeab88683d380c6dfe3433918792e328e71dd2

commit_message:
Use the ephemeral disk on rackspace performance nodes

They don't come with swap, so match what we do for HP.

Change-Id: I4f81608c962bb7c1a03e7b5597759c1f40c0971c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/47/60347/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # HPCloud and Rackspace performance nodes provide no swap, but do # have ephemeral disks we can use. HPCloud also doesn't have # enough space on / for two devstack installs, so we partition the # disk and mount it on /opt, syncing the previous contents of /opt # over. if [ `grep SwapTotal /proc/meminfo | awk '{ print $2; }'` -eq 0 ]; then if [ -b /dev/vdb ]; then DEV='/dev/vdb' elif [ -b /dev/xvde ]; then DEV='/dev/vde' fi if [ -z "$DEV" ]; then sudo umount ${DEV} sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mklabel msdos sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mkpart primary linux-swap 0 8192 sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mkpart primary ext2 8192 -1 sudo mkswap ${DEV}1 sudo mkfs.ext4 ${DEV}2 sudo swapon ${DEV}1 sudo mount ${DEV}2 /mnt sudo rsync -a /opt/ /mnt/ sudo umount /mnt sudo mount ${DEV}2 /opt fi
deleted_lines: # Hpcloud provides no swap, but does have a virtual disk mounted # at /mnt we can use. It also doesn't have enough space on / for # two devstack installs, so we partition the vdisk: if [ `grep SwapTotal /proc/meminfo | awk '{ print $2; }'` -eq 0 ] && \ [ -b /dev/vdb ]; then sudo umount /dev/vdb sudo parted /dev/vdb --script -- mklabel msdos sudo parted /dev/vdb --script -- mkpart primary linux-swap 0 8192 sudo parted /dev/vdb --script -- mkpart primary ext2 8192 -1 sudo mkswap /dev/vdb1 sudo mkfs.ext4 /dev/vdb2 sudo swapon /dev/vdb1 sudo mount /dev/vdb2 /opt

commit_message:
Removes log generation parameters from EXTRA_OPTS

Reasons:
- No need of using these parameters.
- Logging could be managed on its own by nova.
- Would help to reduce logfiles generation,
  hence making the maintenance easier.
- All other components are already doing this way.

Changes:
- Removed logdir from EXTRA_OPTS.
- Removed logfile_mode from EXTRA_OPTS.

If needed by user, one can modify the nova.conf to
generate logfiles at their desired location.

Change-Id: I301b8a2fa1522965442efa72e21085389ee662f8
Closes-Bug: #1260648

deleted_lines: EXTRA_OPTS=(lock_path=$USERHOME/nova_locks logdir=$TROVE_LOGDIR logfile_mode=660 rescan_timeout=180 resizefs_timeout=240 force_dhcp_release=False host=`hostname`.`hostname --domain`)

commit_message:
Fix parse_isotime filter into horizon

    parse_isotime was imported from oslo to horizon and became a filter,
    but it can raise an exception. If it occurs the template in which
    we use the filter will be broken. A fix has been made that allows the
    filter to fail silently and display a configurable default value.
    Some tests are now performed on this filter. According to Django
    defaultfilters nothing is logged when the evaluation fails.

Fixes bug #1253161

Change-Id: If44cde62c37371c5de7b7f81860f368f61b066bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/57545/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def parse_isotime(timestr, default="Unknown"): @register.filter annotation and a silent fallback on error. default = iso8601.parse_date(timestr) except iso8601.ParseError: pass except TypeError: pass finally: return default
deleted_lines: def parse_isotime(timestr): @register.filter annotation. return iso8601.parse_date(timestr) except iso8601.ParseError as e: raise ValueError(e.message) except TypeError as e: raise ValueError(e.message)

Fix tenant of admin can't delete vm

when tenant of admin create vm in another tenant's network,it allow to
delete that vm.

Fixes:bug #1261633

commit_message:
Retry on deadlock in instance_metadata_update

THe instance_metadata_update() method in the sqlalchemy db API may hit a
DBDeadlock, as shown in the bug report.  Apply the necessary decorator
that will have the method retry in that case.

Change-Id: Ice3f13857ba8f4ee1d1d2dc06cef293e6d17daca
Closes-bug: #1262154

commit_message:
Using contain_class instead of include_class

Per rspec-puppet-1.0.1 warning:

DEPRECATION: include_class is deprecated. Use contain_class instead.
Called from .../vendor/gems/rspec-puppet-1.0.1/lib/rspec-puppet/
matchers/include_class.rb:7

Change-Id: I6b410bc4d294bdc6f4feb65a18b213f88b5184f1

subject: Use Fedora 20 for DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_HEAT_SLOW
revisions:

This adds a Fedora 20 image to IMAGE_URLS and sets
$HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE so that tempest is configured to

Fedora 20 has heat-cfntools pre-installed, so there is no

commit_message:
Use Fedora 20 for DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_HEAT_SLOW

This adds a Fedora 20 image name to
$HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE so that tempest is configured to
use it for orchestration tests requiring an image.

Fedora 20 has heat-cfntools pre-installed, so there is no
current need to run diskimage-builder during the gate run.

A separate change to devstack/stackrc will add the actual
URL to IMAGE_URLS which corresponds to this image name.

Change-Id: Iddfc6629f7c0108cb2a19c09e719ed839989bdb5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/76/61576/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE=False" >>localrc # Use Fedora 20 for heat test image, it has heat-cfntools pre-installed echo "IMAGE_URLS+=,\"https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/alt/stage/20-TC5/Images/i386/Fedora-i386-20-TC5-20131205-sda.qcow2\"" >>localrc echo "HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE=Fedora-i386-20-TC5-20131205-sda.qcow2" >>localrc
deleted_lines: # When uncommented this will download and register the most recent successfully built # ubuntu-vm-heat-cfntools image from jenkins.tripleo.org # echo "IMAGE_URLS+=,\"http://jenkins.tripleo.org:8080/job/autobuilt-images/elements=ubuntu%20vm%20heat-cfntools/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ubuntu-vm-heat-cfntools.qcow2\"" >>localrc echo "HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE=True" >>localrc

commit_message:
Adds method for misc options

This change adds support for miscellaneous options to be set.
Things that haven't been added as attributes, or specifically,
third party additions that don't belong in stackforge (e.g. cobalt)

Change-Id: Ib312333283275fa3581c912f8c55c8f2c6191705

commit_message:
Removing conditional around client status code check

The response object should always have a status_code on it.

Change-Id: I341c6297a199ced88df2a39c9c8d6a4bbb5c057f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient refs/changes/13/63013/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status = resp.status_code if resp is not None else None
deleted_lines: status = resp.status_code if resp else None

commit_message:
Fix failures when l3_agent_scheduler ext is not available

Some plugins do not support the L3 agent scheduler extension.
Therefore, make the tests that rely on it dependent on whether
this is actually available in the plugin under test.

Change-Id: I3154b646677379a34465c6826b71d4ad72c471a2
Closes-bug: #1231152
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/62097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import test @test.attr(type='smoke') # of extensions returned, but only for those that have been # enabled via configuration for e in expected_alias: if test.is_extension_enabled(e, 'network'): self.assertIn(e, actual_alias)
deleted_lines: from tempest.test import attr @attr(type='smoke') # of extensions returned for e in expected_alias: self.assertIn(e, actual_alias)

commit_message:
Bug #1261894: Deleting Record With BIND 9 Driver Fails

Fix the delete_record() method so it deletes the record in the central storage before the BIND 9 backend gets the request to delete the record.

Change-Id: I0d1e00f441d2f2026734d90e7f015fdd40c7e137
Closes-bug: #1261894

deleted_lines: yield self.storage.get_recordset(context, recordset_id)

subject: scenario cross_tenant_connectivity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-03 21:00:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/5dc003fa7693a0557cf9667743f8643b675ae0a1', 'message': 'scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

This test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with
Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity
as follows

ssh:
    in order to overcome "ip namespace", each tenant has an "access point"  VM
    with floating-ip open to incoming ssh connection allowing network commands
    (ping/ssh) to be executed from within the tenant-network-namespace
    Tempest host performs key-based authentication to the ssh server via
    floating IP address

setup:
    for each tenant (demo and alt):
        1. create a network&subnet
        2. create a router (if public router isn't configured)
        3. connect tenant network to public network via router
        4. create an access point:
            a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
            b. a VM with a floating ip
        5. for demo tenant - create another server to test in-tenant connections

connectivity test is done by pinging destination server via source server ssh
connection.
success - ping returns
failure - ping_timeout reached

tests:
        1. _verify_network_details
        2. _verify_mac_addr: for each access point verify that
        (subnet, fix_ip, mac address) are as defined in the port list
        3. _test_in_tenant_block: test that in-tenant traffic is disabled
        without rules allowing it
        4. _test_in_tenant_allow: test that in-tenant traffic is enabled once an
        appropriate rule has been created
        5. _test_cross_tenant_block: test that cross-tenant traffic is disabled
        without a rule allowing it on destination tenant
        6. _test_cross_tenant_allow:
            * test that cross-tenant traffic is enabled once an
            * appropriate rule
            has been created on destination tenant.
            * test that reverse traffic is still blocked
            * test than revesre traffic is enabled once an
            * appropriate
            * rule has been created on source tenant

assumptions:
        1. alt_tenant/user existed and is different from demo_tenant/user
        2. Public network is defined and reachable from the Tempest host
        3. Public router can either be:
            * defined, in which case all tenants networks can
            * connect directly
            to it, and cross tenant check will be done on the private IP of the
            destination tenant
            or
            * not defined (empty string), in which case each tanant
            * will have
            its own router connected to the public network

helper changes:

manager:

    (from scenario/test_network_basic_ops)

    python-neutronclient (preventing tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron
    resources

Change-Id: I212873d46e20ff3161e376105af18020b1cf1c9d

commit_message:
scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

test conectivity between VMs in the same tenant and on different
tenants.
for each case, test that default state blocks traffic(*), that security
rules allow only specified traffic

(*)negative connectivity check is skipped until bug 1252620 is fixed
   TODO(yfried): enable them once bug is fixed

Also adds workaround for bug 1247568 in python-neutronclient (preventing
tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron resources

Change-Id: I212873d46e20ff3161e376105af18020b1cf1c9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/01/55101/34 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from tempest.api.network import common as net_common def _get_router(self, tenant_id): """Retrieve a router for the given tenant id. If a public router has been configured, it will be returned. If a public router has not been configured, but a public network has, a tenant router will be created and returned that routes traffic to the public network. """ router_id = self.config.network.public_router_id network_id = self.config.network.public_network_id if router_id: result = self.network_client.show_router(router_id) return net_common.AttributeDict(**result['router']) elif network_id: router = self._create_router(tenant_id) router.add_gateway(network_id) return router else: raise Exception("Neither of 'public_router_id' or " "'public_network_id' has been defined.") def _create_router(self, tenant_id, namestart='router-smoke-'): name = rand_name(namestart) body = dict( router=dict( name=name, admin_state_up=True, tenant_id=tenant_id, ), ) result = self.network_client.create_router(body=body) router = net_common.DeletableRouter(client=self.network_client, **result['router']) self.assertEqual(router.name, name) self.set_resource(name, router) return router def _create_networks(self): network = self._create_network(self.tenant_id) router = self._get_router(self.tenant_id) subnet = self._create_subnet(network) subnet.add_to_router(router.id) self.networks.append(network) self.subnets.append(subnet) self.routers.append(router)

subject: Refactor network client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 13:58:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6916fa28a95ba737dd5ad89ad8e424d815cc7d1e', 'message': "Refactor network client

This patch implements the following steps in network client refactoring
1) Automatically 'generated' list_, show_, delete_ methods for most of
the resources
2) XML and JSon client implementations inherit common base
3) Every list method now supports filters

This change allow to remove existing list_, show_ and delete_ methods for
simple resources from both clients.

Some tests were fixed to simplify mapping between client method name and
resulting URI (example: list_floatingips instead of list_floating_ips)

Change-Id: I0eb46f8e3d90809dbfc54d4a250cd6aecfdc2c3b

commit_message:
Refactor network client

This patch implements the following steps in network client refactoring
1) Automatically 'generated' list_, show_, delete_ methods for most of
the resources
2) XML and JSon client implementations inherit common base
3) Every list method now supports filters

This change allow to remove existing list_, show_ and delete_ methods for
simple resources from both clients.

Some tests were fixed to simplify mapping between client method name and
resulting URI (example: list_floatingips instead of list_floating_ips)

Change-Id: I0eb46f8e3d90809dbfc54d4a250cd6aecfdc2c3b

commit_message:
This patch adds a user authentication of incoming request.

A new option enable_authentication is introduced in solum.conf
to control incoming request authentication via keystone. By default this
option has value True.
If this option is enabled (has value True) a keystoneclient.auth_token
middleware will be installed.

test_functional.py file has beed removed as it is not
compatible with authentication changes. Tests from test_functional file
will be added to functionaltest folder by a separate commit.

This patch adds python_keystoneclient into requirements.txt
Change-Id: I16aa0ba66eb8f5bf74e955245baba43118c89057
Implements: blueprint user-authentication

added_lines: # -*- encoding: utf-8 -*- # # # # Author: Georgy Okrokvertskhov <gokrokvertskhov@mirantis.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from keystoneclient.middleware import auth_token from oslo.config import cfg OPT_GROUP_NAME = 'keystone_authtoken' LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) auth_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('auth_strategy', default='noauth', help='The strategy to use for auth: noauth or keystone.'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(auth_opts) CONF.register_opts(auth_token.opts, group=OPT_GROUP_NAME) def setup_authentication(app, conf): if conf.get('auth_strategy') == 'keystone': return auth_token.AuthProtocol(app, conf=dict(conf.get(OPT_GROUP_NAME))) else: return app

commit_message:
Adds non-volume-support to create server with heat

Reasons:
- There is no supporting code for CONF.trove_volume_support = False.

Changes:
- Added code for CONF.trove_volume_support = False.

Change-Id: I048169e20c3ac713f44e7df85e6b691b707fa88c
Closes-Bug: #1262357

commit_message:
Parameterize the dhcp_lease_time

This change allows the site operator to override the
default dhcp_lease_time provided to DHCP clients in the
event they want a different value from the 120s default.

Change-Id: I7020120ef3ffcf5d9e73f48f3ebdaff853298842

commit_message:
Make wsgi attributes overridable

Allow the site operator to override wsgi attributes
and allows access to an api_workers attribute present
in Havana but also in Grizzly sites that are patched with
the following patch:

https://gist.github.com/alanmeadows/7770570

Change-Id: I6495c9f6095e686d9504ad8dde59c9b9696dc3ba

commit_message:
Make Heat's non_empty_stack usable without a server

We don't really need to test with a server to check Heat's
API responses. So just use a trivial resource type (a LaunchConfig)
to create some objects that we can query against. Now we can use
this test to gate.

Change-Id: I71bc065d8a1d2064ca90406543a376ce4d477275

commit_message:
Add Orchestration attributes to attribute file

Add Orchestration endpoint and database attribute to default attribute file,
which will be used by orchestration cookbook

Implements: blueprint heat-support

Change-Id: Ib6aa3f4e9346992308676e041ab2f0a0397abeac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/88/59088/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ******************** OpenStack Orchestration Endpoints *************************** # The OpenStack Orchestration (Heat) API endpoint default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api']['host'] = "127.0.0.1" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api']['scheme'] = "http" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api']['port'] = "8004" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api']['path'] = "/v1/%(tenant_id)s" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api']['bind_interface'] = nil # The OpenStack Orchestration (Heat) CloudFormation API endpoint default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cfn']['host'] = "127.0.0.1" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cfn']['scheme'] = "http" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cfn']['port'] = "8000" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cfn']['path'] = "/v1" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cfn']['bind_interface'] = nil # The OpenStack Orchestration (Heat) CloudWatch API endpoint default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cloudwatch']['host'] = "127.0.0.1" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cloudwatch']['scheme'] = "http" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cloudwatch']['port'] = "8003" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cloudwatch']['path'] = "/v1" default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cloudwatch']['bind_interface'] = nil # default['openstack']['endpoints']['identity-api']['uri'] = "https://identity.example.com:35357/v2.0" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['identity-admin']['uri'] = "https://identity.example.com:5000/v2.0" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['compute-api']['uri'] = "https://compute.example.com:8774/v2/%(tenant_id)s" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['compute-ec2-api']['uri'] = "https://ec2.example.com:8773/services/Cloud" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['compute-ec2-admin']['uri'] = "https://ec2.example.com:8773/services/Admin" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['compute-xvpvnc']['uri'] = "https://xvpvnc.example.com:6081/console" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['compute-novnc']['uri'] = "https://novnc.example.com:6080/vnc_auto.html" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['image-api']['uri'] = "https://image.example.com:9292/v2" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['image-registry']['uri'] = "https://image.example.com:9191/v2" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['volume-api']['uri'] = "https://volume.example.com:8776/v1/%(tenant_id)s" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['metering-api']['uri'] = "https://metering.example.com:9000/v1" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api']['uri'] = "https://orchestration.example.com:8004//v1/%(tenant_id)s" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cfn']['uri'] = "https://orchestration.example.com:8000/v1" # default['openstack']['endpoints']['orchestration-api-cloudwatch']['uri'] = "https://orchestration.example.com:8003/v1"# Database used by OpenStack Orchestration (Heat) default['openstack']['db']['orchestration']['db_type'] = node['openstack']['db']['service_type'] default['openstack']['db']['orchestration']['host'] = "127.0.0.1" default['openstack']['db']['orchestration']['port'] = node['openstack']['db']['port'] default['openstack']['db']['orchestration']['db_name'] = "heat"

subject: ceph::mon create or destroy monitors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-17 22:06:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph/commit/0bc2004a29fcbede8d3f0bc69a0e983d31c26220', 'message': 'implement mon::ceph

This is a draft implementation that can deploy a single mon + destroy
it. It successfully runs in the integration test environment.

It raises a few questions and is open for discussion:

* exposing configuration thru facts

  It is essenstial for the puppet module to know the values of ceph
  configuration options. The mon-data configuration value is where files
  such as done or upstart must be created. It would also be quite
  difficult ( and time consuming to maintain) to implement the puppet
  module so that it exactly and precisely reflect how ceph sets all
  configuration options.

  By exposing the configuration via custom facts, the puppet module can
  fully delegate the interpretation of configuration options to ceph and
  be 100% sure they are accurate. In a nutshell, this is done by
  creating a facter script that runs

      ceph --id ID --show-config

  The downside of this approach is that the puppet module must be run
  twice : first to install the facter script, second to do the actual
  work based on the values exposed by the facter script. For instance,
  the ceph::mon module does

      install ceph --id ID --show-config in /etc/facter/facts.d/ceph.sh

      if $::mon_data != undef {
          deploy mon
      }

   the first time around, the script is installed and the $::mon_data
   fact is null, therefore nothing else is done. The second time around,
   the script is in place and $::mon_data == /var/lib/ceph/mon/mon-a and
   the "deploy mon" part of the puppet module is run.

* resource ordering

  The resource ordering uses a form like:

     class { ...
     }
     ->
     class { ...
     }

   when possible so that is looks like sequential code although it is
   not. When conditional statements must be included ( such as dealing
   with various key managemnt policies ), the following for is used to
   relate to the previous resource:

     File['foobar'] -> Class['frobnitz']

* coping with key management policies

   All key management are enumerated with the following cases:

   * no key management ( auth_supported = 'none' )
     the keyring file is set to /dev/null when --mkfs because there is
     no way to do otherwise and the keyring file is created empty
     in the mon-data directory because it is checked at boot time
     although it is not used

   * keys provided in the puppet master
     the puppetmaster contains hardcoded ( manually generated ) keys
     that are passed as arguments to the ceph::mon class as follows:

     class { 'ceph::mon':
        key = 'xxxxxxxxxxxxx',
     }

     the key is set in a temporary keyfile that is removed after the
     --mkfs of the monitor.

   * keys managed by the puppet-secret module or a similar class
     the key are also controlled by the puppetmaster which is ultimately
     trusted, but they are not set in clear. Instead they are exposed
     as follows:

     class { 'ceph::mon':
        key = secret('mon-key'),
     }

     from the point of view of the ceph::mon module, they are no
     different than the hardcoded keys.

   * keys managed by a mechanism external to puppet
     the puppetmaster does not have permission to retrieve the keys. It
     relies on a third party copy mechanism to prepare the keyring
     before ceph::mon is called. The ceph::mon module assumes that the
     keyring file already exists when it is called and that it is placed
     exactly where it should be. For instance:

     class { 'ceph::mon':
        keyring = '/tmp/ceph-mon-a.kering',
     }

     more information about this use case at
     https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Puppet-openstack/ceph-blueprint#Keeping_keys_.2F_secrets_out_of_Puppet

   The ceph::mon module implements all cases by requiring that either
   the $key or $keyring arguments are provided when $authentication_type
   == cephx and that they are mutually exclusive.

* articulation with the configuration file

  ceph::mon requires that class { 'ceph': ... } is called before it to
  set the configuration file. It heavily relies on it to properly setup
  the monitor.

  in order to support the deployment of multiple ceph clusters on the
  same host, the ceph.conf configuration file can be passed as an
  argument to ceph::mon.

Change-Id: Ic56a4124738006f7946ee9c166295f7048cb7854
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>
